items.title: Annual Review
items.summary:
This 30 to 60 minute eLearning module supports an annual review of the Standards of Conduct, Oath of Employment, Appropriate Use Policy and tests for comprehension. The Annual Review of Standards of Conduct and Oath of Employment is a mandatory requirement that must be completed on an ongoing, annual basis.
 
**Exceptions:**

- New employees: Complete the Annual Review only after your first year of employment and every year after that. Ensure you have completed the Oath of Employment within the first 90 days of being hired. [Learn more about how you can take and complete the Oath](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/careers-myhr/all-employees/new-employees/when-you-start/first-three-months/oath).
- BC Corrections and Sheriffs’ Division staff: Complete a customized Annual Review of the Standards of Conduct and Oath of Employment eModule found in the Learning System.

items.title: Advanced Professional Certificate in Behavioural Insights
items.summary:
**Become a behavioural insights practitioner.** The Advanced Professional Certificate in Behavioural Insights (BI) is a rigorous nine-month program **from the University of British Columbia (UBC**) that gives you the knowledge and skills to design and evaluate BI solutions in your workplace. By accounting for the ways that people make decisions and behave in the real world, BI improves programs and policies in ways that encourage positive changes in citizens, employees, and others. 

The certificate runs September-May each year; **May 31, 2025 is the final deadline to apply** for the Sept. 2025-May 2026 cohort.

**Eligible for [Pacific Leaders Scholarship](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content?id=317AA05B6C7E4592997B2E1EBD4E926B) funding!**

If you're interested in this certificate and have missed the deadline for the 2025-2026 academic year, you still have the opportunity to complete the pre-requisite course, [Fundamentals of Behavioural Insights](https://learningcentre.gww.gov.bc.ca/learninghub/course/ubc-bi-fundamentals/)! Please follow the link for more details.

The Advanced Professional Certificate in Behavioural Insights and Fundamentals of Behavioural Insights courses are delivered by UBC and so are not documented in the BC Public Service Learning System.
items.content_text: Advanced Professional Certificate in Behavioural Insights
items.author: Behavioural Insights

items.title: Fundamentals of Behavioural Insights
items.summary:
This three-week course **from the University of British Columbia (UBC**) provides an overview of how behavioural insights can be used to: (1) understand how people make decisions and behave in the real world; (2) design programs and policies in ways that encourage positive changes in citizens, employees, and others; and (3) rigorously evaluate the impact of these programs and policies. This course is a pre-requisite for UBC’s Advanced Professional Certificate in Behavioural Insights.

Next intake: November 10, 2025

This course is delivered by UBC so is not documented in the BC Public Service Learning System.
items.content_text: Fundamentals of Behavioural Insights
items.author: Behavioural Insights

items.title: BIG Difference BC Conference
items.summary:
BIG Difference BC is a free, annual conference that celebrates using the behavioural and decision sciences for positive social impact by sharing case studies, research results, best practices, and lessons learned from across a wide range of topics and sectors. 

BIG Difference BC 2025 on November 7, 2025 will shine a spotlight on “**Changing Behaviour in Complex Systems**”. Join us for a free, online, and outstanding program celebrating using the behavioural and decision sciences for positive social impact across priority challenges in B.C. and beyond.

Registration will be available in early September and this page will be updated with the link at that time.

**Presentations are available** from the 2024 (and previous) conferences on the [**BIG Difference BC website**](https://bigdifferencebc.ca/past). There is a lot of great learning available there!
items.content_text: BIG Difference BC Conference
items._keywords: behavioural insights
items.author: Behavioural Insights

Workplaces recognize the benefits of mindfulness meditation-focused programming for employees, including stress management, increased resilience, reduced health risks, and enhanced effectiveness in the workplace. Learn about mindfulness through **guided meditations** and other resources.

items.title: FOIPPA Foundations – Privacy and Access in B.C.
items.summary:
*FOIPPA Foundations* is an online course that supports learners to understand their privacy and access obligations in BC. This interactive course reflects the 2021 amendments to the *Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act* (FOIPPA) and provides learners with an overview of:

- The fundamentals of FOIPPA

- Their responsibilities under FOIPPA

- How FOIPPA applies to their work

- Their privacy and access obligations

Target audiences for the course include public body employees in the broader public sector, as well as BC public service employees and contracted service providers. The course is optional for BC public service employees.

For additional information, please contact: [privacy.helpline@gov.bc.ca](mailto:privacy.helpline@gov.bc.ca).
items.content_text: FOIPPA Foundations – Privacy and Access in B.C.

items.title: Inclusive Hiring: What’s new in hiring?
items.summary: Inclusive hiring might not immediately come to mind when a modern public service is mentioned. But, in fact, it’s a critical piece of the puzzle. Where Ideas Work asks us to respond to and even anticipate the diverse needs and expectations of citizens of BC. We will be in a better position to do this if our workforce reflects that very diversity. So what are we doing  to get there? In this five-episode podcast series we’re going to explore some of the things that have been happening in the BC Public Service.
items.content_text: Inclusive Hiring: What’s new in hiring?

items.title: Getting Started with Teams
items.summary:
With Microsoft Teams, you can chat, hold meetings, share files, and work together with others in one place. Join this session to learn the basics, like how to navigate and customize Teams, manage your profile and settings, create and manage teams and channels, and use tools like chat, calls, and the calendar for meetings. 

**Prerequisites**: None 
**Duration:** 60 min.
**Delivery format:** Live training, online
**Learning objectives:**

- Learn to navigate and customize the Teams interface, use the navigation pane, and adjust options and settings
- Find out how to manage profile, status, data storage, and settings to improve the Teams experience
- Understand how to create and manage teams and channels, understand channel types, use shortcuts for files in OneDrive/SharePoint, explore team roles, and post in channels
- Find out how to start and manage chats, pin conversations, make calls, and use the calendar for meetings

Watch a [past session recording](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Getting-started--recorded-training.aspx). 

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.title: Microsoft Teams Basics learning guide
items.summary:
[Microsoft Teams](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Teams-overview.aspx) is a collaboration app built for hybrid work, so you and your team stay informed, organized, and connected. Create teams within the application to meet, chat, make calls, share documents, and collaborate all in one place.   

This learning guide is designed for BC Public Service employees who need to learn the basics of using Teams. 

**Prerequisites: **None 

**Duration:** 2 - 5 hr

**Delivery format:** Learning guide 

**Learning objectives: ** 

- Navigate the Microsoft Teams interface 

- Communicate within chats, teams, and channels 

- Create and join a meeting 

- Locate and organize files 

- Identify the steps to take when transitioning from Skype to MS Team 

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.title: Your Digital Workplace
items.summary:
[Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Home.aspx), created and managed by the OCIO, is the hub for BC Public Service employees to learn about, stay up to date and find training on the Microsoft 365 (M365) tools we use in our work every day. With this site you can:

- Learn how to get the most out of our **[M365 cloud-based digital tools](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Digital-tools-landing.aspx)** such as Teams, SharePoint Online, and OneDrive

- Discover the exciting **features** that come with M365 products

- Find out about** [information management](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Privacy-and-security.aspx) **for cloud-based tools

- Check out our **[learning guides](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) **and watch **[recorded training](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Recorded-training.aspx)**

- Take advantage of **[live training](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Live-training.aspx) **opportunities, including [Tech Tuesday](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Tech-Tuesday--live-training(1).aspx?web=1&OR=Teams-HL&CT=1736889964639&clickparams=eyJBcHBOYW1lIjoiVGVhbXMtRGVza3RvcCIsIkFwcFZlcnNpb24iOiI0OS8yNDEyMDEwMDIxMyJ9&%3D&sdata=dEtRT2VuWjVSQ0FRWGxSeWN5UWlkRGpqendWQ3ZHYTJsS3F5dGNoZDlnTT0%3D&ovuser=6fdb5200-3d0d-4a8a-b036-d3685e359adc%2CDigitalWorkplace.Training%40gov.bc.ca), [Getting started](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Getting-Started.aspx), and [Beyond the basics](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Teams-Conferencing--Meetings,-webinars-and-live-events.aspx)

You can also join in the conversation at [M365: Your Digital Workplace](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/team/19:3f42241a21f843909065f3f46a9c6579%40thread.skype/conversations?groupId=9ce3a923-0bfb-4230-8ad4-4a31e74680c3&tenantId=6fdb5200-3d0d-4a8a-b036-d3685e359adc) in MS Teams! Learn from and engage with peers and technology experts from across government.
items.content_text: Your Digital Workplace

items.title: Human-Centered Design 201: Prototyping
items.summary:
**On-demand | 4 weeks elearning | virtual | free**

Strengthen your existing knowledge of the human-centered design process and use prototyping as a low-cost and risk-averse way to get your ideas into the hands of the people you’re trying to change.  You’ll learn the methods IDEO.org designers use to quickly bring ideas to life with prototypes, test those ideas in the field, and collect feedback and arrive at solutions that meet the needs of the people you’re designing for.

***Who should attend?***  Intermediate level.  We recommend you complete the [Introduction to Human-Centered Design](https://learningcentre.gww.gov.bc.ca/learninghub/course/introduction-to-human-centered-design/) course beforehand.
items.content_text: Human-Centered Design 201: Prototyping
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: How to Use Data Effectively in the Public Service
items.summary:
**On-demand | 1 hour webinar | virtual | free**

Learn about the benefits of using data, recognize key stakeholders, and identify common data issues.  This is a pre-recorded webinar and includes links to numerous resources.

***Who should attend?***  Introductory level.  Anyone who wants to learn how to use data to improve public services, policy making, and performance, whether your role directly relates to data or not.
items.content_text: How to Use Data Effectively in the Public Service
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: How to Master Data Literacy in the Public Service
items.summary:
**On-demand | 1 hour webinar | virtual | free**

Learn fundamental concepts of data literacy and empower yourself with the skills to utilise data effectively in your role.  This is a pre-recorded webinar and includes links to numerous resources.

***Who should attend?*** Introductory level.  This is best suited for anyone new to working with data or seeking a refresher on foundational skills.
items.content_text: How to Master Data Literacy in the Public Service
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: How to Create Your Own Data Visualisation
items.summary:
**On-demand | 1 hour webinar | virtual | free**

Learn why data visualisation is important and discover tips and tools to create your own data visualisation.  This is a pre-recorded webinar and includes links to numerous resources.

***Who should attend?*** Introductory level.  For those who want to learn more about data visualisation, why it’s important, and how to create their own.
items.content_text: How to Create Your Own Data Visualisation
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: Respectful Workplace
items.summary: Strengthen your understanding of respectful behaviour in the workplace and why it matters. Understand how you can contribute to a respectful workplace and your responsibilities under policy and legislation and the resources available to support you if you experience or witness a respectful workplace issue.
items.content_text: Respectful Workplace
items.author: PSA Corporate Learning Branch

items.title: Introduction to Anti-racism in Research
items.summary:
This course takes approximately 90 minutes to complete and is designed to provide you with information, strategies and tools to help you integrate the core principles and some of the best practices of anti-racism research involving data.

During the course, you will become familiar with:

- The goals and objectives of the Anti-Racism Data Act
- Some principles of anti-racism and data justice
- The basics of cultural safety, consideration of community harm, intersectionality, transparency and data accessibility
- How to apply these concepts in your research practice

The course consists of four modules and a final quiz. Once you have completed all four modules, you will be required to earn a minimum of 80% on the final quiz to receive your certificate.
items.content_text: Introduction to Anti-racism in Research
items.author: PSA Corporate Learning Branch

items.title: Mindsets for a Digital Future: Working with Others
items.summary:
**On-demand | 2 hour elearning | virtual | free**

Learn about essential mindsets that will help you successfully work with others in a digital environment. Developed in partnership with the Ontario Digital Service.

***Who should attend?***  Introductory level.  Anyone who wants to develop key mindsets to prepare for a digital future, whether or not you're currently working on a digital-focused team.
items.content_text: Mindsets for a Digital Future: Working with Others
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: Mindsets for a Digital Future: Developing Yourself
items.summary:
**On-demand | 2 hour elearning  | virtual | free**

Learn about key mindsets to help you adapt and thrive in the new digital world: self-awareness, growth, inclusion, resilience, and critical thinking and curiosity. Developed in partnership with the Ontario Digital Service.

***Who should attend?***  Introductory level.  Anyone who wants to develop mindsets to prepare for a digital future, whether or not they work in digital.
items.content_text: Mindsets for a Digital Future: Developing Yourself
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: Understand How AI Impacts You and Your Government
items.summary:
**On-demand | 4-5 hour elearning | virtual | free**

Demystify Artificial Intelligence (AI).  Gain a foundational understanding of AI without getting into the technical weeds.  Discover how it's already being used in your day-to-day life, when it has harmed and helped in the public sector, how to identify and prevent that harm, and how it can make your job easier and improve services.  Explore AI tools with guided activities and leave with checklists and conversation starters.

***Who should attend? ***This is a practical, introductory course that suits people at all levels.  There is no need for technical expertise or regular use of AI tools.  It is ideal if you:

- Are new to the AI world and want an introduction to the topic.

- Want guidance and practice with popular AI tools like ChatGPT.

- Want to get involved in the work going on within the BC Government to establish policies, and consider ethics, privacy, societal impact, etc.

Have some or lots of experience?  You can still benefit from this course and will finish it in a shorter time period if you are using an AI tool regularly OR working with AI in a government context.
items.content_text: Understand How AI Impacts You and Your Government
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: Responsible AI for Public Professionals: Using Generative AI at Work
items.summary:
**On-demand | 5 hour elearning | virtual | free**

Generative Artificial Intelligence (GenAI) has the potential to revolutionize work in government. Safely explore the benefits, risks, and best practices for using GenAI responsibly through use cases and hands-on activities. By the end of this seven module course, you'll understand how Gen AI could be integrated into your day-to-day work and be used to make informed decisions while maintaining public trust and safety.

***Who should attend?*** This is a practical, introductory course that suits people with a basic understanding of what GenAI is and would like to understand how it could be used in the workplace. Technical expertise or regular use of AI tools is not required.

*Please note:* to participate in the hands-on exercises, you will be asked to create accounts for free tools such as ChatGPT.  We recommend reviewing the BC Government's [Responsible use of artificial intelligence: Draft principles](https://digital.gov.bc.ca/policies-standards/ai/) beforehand.
items.content_text: Responsible AI for Public Professionals: Using Generative AI at Work
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: OpenShift 101 Workshop & Lab
items.summary:
**Various dates | 3 weeks online classes | virtual | free**

Get ready to build and deploy your applications for BC Government on OpenShift.  In this multi-day online workshop and lab you will learn the basics of OpenShift, understand how to get onboarded to the platform, and discover techniques to troubleshoot common issues.

***Who should attend?***  Practitioners.  Focused on developers/devops specialists who will be building cloud-native applications for BC Government on OpenShift.  Content is technical and assumes some technical knowledge.
items.content_text: OpenShift 101 Workshop & Lab
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: OpenShift 201 Workshop & Lab
items.summary:
**Various dates | 2 days online classes | virtual | free**

Build on your [OpenShift 101](https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/openshift-201-workshop-lab-tickets-381308362577) training and experience working with an application team on the BC Government Private Cloud Platform.  In this 2-day online workshop and lab, learn advanced technical topics for working on OpenShift, then apply your knowledge.

***Who should attend?***  Practitioners.  Focused on developers/devops specialists who are building cloud-native applications for BC Government on OpenShift.

***Pre-requisites:***  Allow at least four weeks between completing OpenShift 101 and beginning OpenShift 201.

- Completed OpenShift 101

- Passed the self-assessment quiz

- Additional details & requirements are listed on the registration page
items.content_text: OpenShift 201 Workshop & Lab
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: Human-Centered Design
items.summary:
**On-demand | 4-5 hours elearning| virtual | free**

Create better public services by putting people first.  Learn about the human centered design framework, including problem framing, empathy interviewing, and prototyping.  Then practice applying the concepts to your work.

***Who should attend?***  Introductory level. For those curious about the human-centered design field or will be working with and/or supporting User Experience Designers.
items.content_text: Human-Centered Design
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: How to Apply User-Centred Design in Government
items.summary:
**On-demand | 1 hour webinar| virtual | free**

To build a government service that meet the users needs, you need to understand the people who will use it. In this panel discussion hear how user-centred design experts start with a user need, get to know their users, the value of co-design and using feedback to make services better, and the challenges they face.

***Who should attend?***  Introductory level.  For those curious about the human or user-centred design fields or how it can be used to create better services.
items.content_text: How to Apply User-Centred Design in Government
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: AI Fundamentals for Public Servants: Opportunities, Risks and Strategies
items.summary:
**On-demand | 7 hours elearning | virtual | free**

Artificial Intelligence (AI) is already shaping government work and you too can unlock the potential.  Led by Stanford University and public sector experts, you'll learn how to navigate AI's complexities, spot opportunities, and leverage it for more ethical outcomes.

***Who should attend?***  Intermediate level.  This is best suited for decision-makers, policy writers, and AI influencers.

***Pre-requisites:***  A basic understanding of Generative AI. Technical expertise is not required.
items.content_text: AI Fundamentals for Public Servants: Opportunities, Risks and Strategies
items.author: Digital Academy

items.title: Getting Started with SharePoint Online
items.summary:
With SharePoint Online, you can create custom online portals to organize and share documents, images, videos, and more. Join this session to learn the essential skills to make the most out of SharePoint Online.

**Prerequisites**: None 

**Duration:** 60 min.

**Delivery format:** Live training, online 

**Learning objectives:**

- Recognize the different types of SharePoint sites and their uses

- Describe the main components of a SharePoint site and how they function

- Create a basic SharePoint page using templates, layouts, and web parts

- Know where to find more information and resources to continue learning about SharePoint

Watch a [past session recording](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Getting-started--SharePoint-Online.aspx).

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.title: Power Apps Basics learning guide
items.summary:
[Power Apps](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-apps/powerapps-overview) is one of the products within the Microsoft [Power Platform](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Power-Platform-overview.aspx?%3D&sdata=eTBYMzZQVitlYTBnQXhjVkFWa2oreTNjKzNTNUlrOTcybzgyQXNZMW5Yaz0%3D&ovuser=6fdb5200-3d0d-4a8a-b036-d3685e359adc%2cMorgan.A.Allen%40gov.bc.ca&OR=Teams-HL&CT=1717523197375&clickparams=eyJBcHBOYW1lIjoiVGVhbXMtRGVza3RvcCIsIkFwcFZlcnNpb24iOiI0OS8yNDA1MDMwNzYxNCIsIkhhc0ZlZGVyYXRlZFVzZXIiOmZhbHNlfQ%3D%3D) suite of low-code development tools.  

Power Apps allows you to build custom professional business apps and automate workflows without traditional coding. With Power Apps, you can also seamlessly connect apps to various data sources, including SharePoint, Dataverse, Excel, and more. 

The Power Apps basics learning guide will help BC Public Service (BCPS) employees with little to no experience get started with Power Apps.   

**Prerequisites: **None 

**Duration:** 2 hr 20 min to 15 hr 

**Delivery format:** Learning guide 

**Learning objectives: ** 

- Understand what Power Apps is and how it works 
- Know how to customize a canvas app in Power Apps 
- Get the skills to connect apps to a variety of data sources 
- Be able to share apps within the organization securely 
- Find out how to connect with experts and other users to ask questions or get help 

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).
items.content_text: Power Apps Basics learning guide

items.title: Power BI Basics learning guide
items.summary:
[Power B](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/fundamentals/power-bi-overview)[I](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/fundamentals/power-bi-overview) is one of the products within the Microsoft [Power Platform](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Power-Platform-overview.aspx) suite of low-code development tools. 

With Power BI, you can create interactive dashboards and reports and analyze data. Use it to connect to multiple data sources, visualize trends, and gain insights to drive decision-making. 

The Power BI basics learning guide will help BC Public Service (BCPS) employees with little to no experience get started with Power BI.   

Prerequisites: None 

Duration: 2 hr. to 17 hr.

Delivery format: Learning guide 

Learning objectives:  

- Understand what Power BI is and how it works 

- Discover how to access Power BI in the BCPS 

- Develop skills to import data, create visualizations, and arrange visualizations into reports 

- Gain hands-on experience using Power BI 

- Find out how to connect with experts and other Power BI users to ask questions and get help 

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.title: Power Automate Basics learning guide
items.summary:
[Power Automate](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/products/power-automate) is one of the products within the Microsoft [Power Platform](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Power-Platform-overview.aspx?%3D&sdata=eTBYMzZQVitlYTBnQXhjVkFWa2oreTNjKzNTNUlrOTcybzgyQXNZMW5Yaz0%3D&ovuser=6fdb5200-3d0d-4a8a-b036-d3685e359adc%2cMorgan.A.Allen%40gov.bc.ca&OR=Teams-HL&CT=1717523197375&clickparams=eyJBcHBOYW1lIjoiVGVhbXMtRGVza3RvcCIsIkFwcFZlcnNpb24iOiI0OS8yNDA1MDMwNzYxNCIsIkhhc0ZlZGVyYXRlZFVzZXIiOmZhbHNlfQ%3D%3D) suite of low-code development tools.  

Use Power Automate to automate repetitive tasks and workflows or integrate it with hundreds of services to streamline processes and notifications. 

The Power Automate basics learning guide will help BC Public Service (BCPS) employees with little to no experience get started with Power Automate. 

**Prerequisites: **None

**Duration:** 60 min. to 19 hr.

**Delivery format:** Learning guide

**Learning objectives: **

- Understand what Power Automate is and how it works 

- Know how to create flows from templates and from scratch 

- Get the skills to connect applications to share data in real time 

- Be able to use Power Automate to streamline business processes 

- Find out how to connect with experts and other users to ask questions or get help 

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.title: Beyond the Basics: Teams applications
items.summary:
Are you ready to take your Teams skills to the next level? Join this live training session to learn how to use Teams applications such as Planner, Power BI, and Polls to increase efficiency, stay organized, and collaborate in a hybrid working setting. 

**Prerequisites**: [Basic knowledge](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Getting-Started.aspx?web=1#teams-orientation-for-new-users) of using Teams recommended

**Duration:** 60 min.

**Delivery format:** Live training, online

**Learning objectives:**

- Recognize the different apps available for use in MS Teams and how they can support cloud-based and hybrid working

- Customize the Rail (navigation pane) by adding, removing, and moving apps to fit your needs

- Add apps to a Teams channel to help with teamwork and getting things done

- Use apps like Whiteboard and Polls during Teams meetings to make them more fun and interactive

- Find more resources and links to learn more about MS Teams apps and their features

- 

Watch a [past session recording](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Teams-Conferencing--Meetings,-webinars-and-live-events.aspx#watch-past-session-recordings). 

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.title: Tech Tuesday recording: Optimize and organize - calm the Chaos in Teams
items.summary:
If you’d like to streamline and improve your experience in your Microsoft Teams workspace, this training is for you! 

In this recorded session, you will learn how to organize your Teams workspace for a more efficient workflow. You will also be given practical tips to help you manage notifications, use the new combined chats and channels feature, and stay informed without feeling overwhelmed.   

Whether you’re just getting started with Teams or you’re a seasoned pro, this session will give you the tools to *calm the chaos* and improve your daily work experience. 

**Prerequisites: **None 

**Duration:** 60 min. 

**Delivery format: **Recorded training 

**Learning objectives: ** 

- Learn how to set up notifications to avoid excessive alerts while staying informed 

- Navigate the combined chats and channels feature to streamline communication 

- Optimize your Teams workspace 

Register to attend [Tech Tuesday: live training](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Tech-Tuesday--live-training(1).aspx).

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.title: Tech Tuesday recording: Valen-Teams Day - fall in love with hybrid meetings
items.summary:
Fall head over heels for hybrid meetings this *Valen-Teams Day*! 💕 In this recorded training session, discover how to create meetings that flow effortlessly and leave everyone feeling included—whether they’re joining in person or remotely. With a little teamwork and a few best practices, you’ll be ready to make every Teams meeting a success.

**Prerequisites: **None 

**Duration:** 60 min. 

**Delivery format: **Recorded training 

**Learning objectives: ** 

- Learn to present and share content effectively for smooth and efficient meetings

- Discover how to use interactive features to spark engagement and bring energy to your meetings

- Master the art of hybrid meetings and help your in-person and remote attendees feel involved with some best practice tips

Register to attend [Tech Tuesday: live training](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Tech-Tuesday--live-training(1).aspx).

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.summary:
Get ready to unwrap the best of Tech Tuesday with our "12 Tips of Tech Tuesday" holiday session! Watch this recorded training session for a festive review of 2024's top tech tips and tricks in Microsoft 365—perfectly packaged and ready to boost your tech game for the new year.

**Prerequisites: **None

**Duration:** 60 min.

**Learning objectives: **

- Know how to use various tools within the M365 suite to help with everyday work

- Discover how cloud-based file sharing can help you collaborate with your team, even if you’re not all in the same place

- Review different apps that can keep your daily tasks in order and reduce mental clutter

- Identify specific tools that can help you communicate better using Teams and email

items.title: Tech Tuesday recording: improve your Outlook
items.summary:
In this recorded training video, you’ll discover the latest tips and tricks for using Outlook and Exchange Online to simplify your work and save you time.  

**Prerequisites: **None 

**Duration:** 60 min. 

**Delivery format: **Recorded training 

**Learning objectives: ** 

- Know the difference between Exchange Online and Outlook 

- Understand how Exchange Online and Outlook work with Microsoft 365 tools like Teams and To Do to improve your productivity 

- Learn tips and shortcut keys to work faster with email and calendar management 

- Use strategies to keep Outlook organized, such as categories, colour coding, flagging and pinning 

- Identify best practices for managing contacts, setting up out-of-office replies, and sharing calendar access with others 

Register to attend [Tech Tuesday: live training](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Tech-Tuesday--live-training(1).aspx).

items.title: Tech Tuesday recording: file management in the cloud (parts 1 + 2)
items.summary:
In these 2-part recorded training videos, you’ll learn the best tips and tricks to stay organized, save time, and manage your files effectively in the cloud.  

At the end of each video, you’ll find a guest presentation from [Government Information Management services](https://www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/governments/services-for-government/information-management-technology/records-management).

**Prerequisites: **None

**Duration: **120 min.

**Delivery format: **Recorded training

**Learning objectives**

- Discover ways to efficiently manage files

- Identify time-saving tips and workflows

- Understand Microsoft 365 (M365) file locations in OneDrive, M365.com, and Teams channels

- Explore Outlook time savers

- Learn best practices for managing government records 

*Note: Tags and My Content were discontinued by Microsoft, effective January 2025. *

Register to attend [Tech Tuesday: live training](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Tech-Tuesday--live-training(1).aspx).

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.summary: This club launched in early 2020 with the goal of developing excellent presentation, facilitation, instruction, and leadership skills across the BC Public Service and today has an active membership of brand-new to distinguished Toastmasters. The BCPS Virtual Communicators meet Thursday’s 12-1pm on MS Teams. Guests are ALWAYS welcome! Contact: [carl.jensen@gov.bc.ca](mailto:carl.jensen@gov.bc.ca) today to join us for a meeting. [Toastmasters International -BC Public Service Virtual Communicators](https://www.toastmasters.org/Find-a-Club/07007776-bc-public-service-virtual-communicators)

items.title: Capital Park Superior Speakers: Tue 12-1pm hybrid
items.summary:
Founded in 2018, [Capital Park Superior Speakers](https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.toastmasters.org%2FFind-a-Club%2F07085759-capital-park-superior-speakers&data=05%7C02%7CCarl.Jensen%40gov.bc.ca%7C6638bfe5fdab449666ea08dd6019e611%7C6fdb52003d0d4a8ab036d3685e359adc%7C0%7C0%7C638772386514825440%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=6c0Hst2O1giOIuypXE4Gspp%2Bk9XrySrhEdzixH%2FirtI%3D&reserved=0) (CPSS) is a dynamic corporate Toastmasters club with a diverse membership, including experienced and distinguished Toastmasters. Our club provides a supportive and engaging environment to develop communication and leadership skills through structured programs, an active Peer Mentorship Program, and plenty of opportunities to refine public speaking skills in a fun and encouraging setting. We welcome guests! Contact us to join one of our meetings and experience the benefits of Toastmasters firsthand. 

We meet on Tuesday from 12:00–1:00 PM in a hybrid format—join us on MS Teams or in person at Capital Park, Room 3003, 525 Superior St, Victoria, BC V8V 1T7, Canada. Contact: Déa Cameron ([Dea.Cameron@gov.bc.ca](mailto:Dea.Cameron@gov.bc.ca))  or [Contact Club](https://can01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.toastmasters.org%2FFind-a-Club%2F07085759-capital-park-superior-speakers%2Fcontact-club%3Fid%3Df3da4a9c-8cd7-ec11-a2fd-005056875f20&data=05%7C02%7CCarl.Jensen%40gov.bc.ca%7C6638bfe5fdab449666ea08dd6019e611%7C6fdb52003d0d4a8ab036d3685e359adc%7C0%7C0%7C638772386514838475%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=sY3FFwDzUIqZ0ivRXLMlkSjWvFryckiD4fV13rjDHKE%3D&reserved=0)

items.title: Tech Tuesday recording: introduction to Power Automate
items.summary:
Power Automate is one tool within the Microsoft [Power Platform](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Power-Platform-overview.aspx?OR=Teams-HL&CT=1717523197375&xsdata=MDV8MDJ8TW9yZ2FuLkEuQWxsZW5AZ292LmJjLmNhfGE2MzljNDE0Mjc1YzQyNDhhOWVlMDhkYzk3YjhhZGVkfDZmZGI1MjAwM2QwZDRhOGFiMDM2ZDM2ODVlMzU5YWRjfDB8MHw2Mzg1NTIwNjY2NDQzOTE0NTV8VW5rbm93bnxUV0ZwYkdac2IzZDhleUpXSWpvaU1DNHdMakF3TURBaUxDSlFJam9pVjJsdU16SWlMQ0pCVGlJNklrMWhhV3dpTENKWFZDSTZNbjA9fDB8fHw%3d&sdata=WjBlVmhCS1JISVVUajR1WGNtUDZzdldQUUt4T1ZueldyMlpPdHptaG1qMD0%3d) set of low-code development tools that enables you to build custom solutions, automate processes, and analyze data.

Power Automate enables you to automate repetitive tasks and workflows, and integrate with hundreds of services to streamline processes and notifications. 

Watch this recorded training session to learn the basics to get started with this tool. 

**Prerequisites: **None

**Duration:** 60 min.  

**Delivery format:** Recorded training

**Learning objectives:**

- Gain insight into how Power Automate can automate repetitive tasks in your day-to-day work

- Discover how Templates and Connectors allow for low-code or no-code automations

- Understand the different types of triggers and how to best utilize them in efficient ways

- Build a flow using triggers and M365 connectors

- Explore potential use cases for Power Automate using more advanced features

Register to attend [Tech Tuesday: live training](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Tech-Tuesday--live-training(1).aspx).

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.title: Tech Tuesday recording: visualizing data with Power BI
items.summary:
In this recorded session, you will learn how to use Power BI to visualize your data. Data visualization helps you tell the story behind your data, making it more compelling and easier to understand. Presenting your data in a visual format enables you to uncover and communicate key business insights.

**Prerequisites: **None

**Duration:** 60 min.  

**Delivery format:** Recorded training

**Learning objectives: **

- Import data from Excel into Power BI Desktop

- Clean up data using Power Query

- Build visuals including heatmaps, slicers, and cards

- Share reports and dashboards with colleagues using the Power BI Service

Register to attend [Tech Tuesday: live training](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Tech-Tuesday--live-training(1).aspx).

items.title: Tech Tuesday recording: video editing with Microsoft Clipchamp
items.summary:
In this recorded session, you will learn how to use [Microsoft Clipchamp](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-365/clipchamp), a free, cloud-based video editor. This tool is for all skill levels.  

Whether you need to trim a meeting recording or create an engaging onboarding video for new employees, Clipchamp has the features to help you get the job done.  

**Prerequisites: **None

**Duration: **60 min.

**Delivery format:** Recorded training

**Learning objectives:** 

- The pros and cons of the video editing tools that are available to BCPS employees 

- The basic features and functions available in Clipchamp 

- How to import media, trim clips, add transitions, and add filters to a video file using Clipchamp 

- How to share and collaborate on editing projects with others through Microsoft 365

Register to attend [Tech Tuesday: live training](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Tech-Tuesday--live-training(1).aspx).

- Learn to effectively use, organize, and customize OneNote notebooks with features like advanced search, custom tags, and organized pages and sections.

- Find out how to integrate OneNote with other Microsoft 365 tools to streamline workflow and improve team collaboration.

- Identify ways to make OneNote notebooks accessible by using alternative text, the Microsoft Accessibility Checker, and voice-to-text features to ensure accessibility for all users

items.title: Breakfast Bytes: Microsoft 365 for busy public servants
items.summary:
Breakfast bytes is a Microsoft 365 (M365) live training series for busy public servants. This series is designed to bring you high-impact, bite-sized M365 tips and tricks before your day gets busy. 

This series is for all BC Public Service employees, including senior leaders, IM/IT professionals, and frontline staff members. 

We know your time is precious, so we’ll keep things short, practical, and straight to the point. 

Join us **every second Tuesday at 8:30 a.m.** for 15 minutes to start your day off right. See [upcoming session dates](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Breakfast-Bytes--Microsoft-365-for-busy-public-servants.aspx#upcoming-session-dates-%282025%29). 
 
**Prerequisites**: None  

**Duration**: 15 min. 

**Delivery format**: Live training, online 

**Learning objectives:**** **

- Learn simple tips to use M365 tools to save time, get organized, and improve team communication 

- Get updates on new features and important changes in M365 tools  

- See real examples of how other staff and leaders are using M365 tools  

- Ask questions and get answers from an M365 expert to help you get the most out of the tools 

- Build useful skills for using tools like Teams, OneDrive, Outlook, and Planner to make your work easier 

Register for the series

Sign up to receive the invites directly in your calendar. You can remove yourself from the series at any time.

[Register now](https://forms.office.com/r/rDsm9V1Uv1)

Join a live session

Want to attend a session without registering for the series? Simply click to join [when the meeting starts](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Breakfast-Bytes--Microsoft-365-for-busy-public-servants.aspx#upcoming-session-dates-%282025%29).[](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Breakfast-Bytes--Microsoft-365-for-busy-public-servants.aspx#join-a-live-session)

[Join the meeting now](https://teams.microsoft.com/l/meetup-join/19:meeting_ZDI2NGE2NmQtMGRmZS00YjgwLWI4N2QtNTllYTE5NzQyYTFi%40thread.v2/0?context=%7b%22Tid%22:%226fdb5200-3d0d-4a8a-b036-d3685e359adc%22%2c%22Oid%22:%22a6827721-1ef6-4018-94cc-3211ac6cdac2%22%7d)

Watch session recordings

Missed a live session or want to watch it again? Check out session recordings.

items.title: Private training: Microsoft 365
items.summary:
The Digital Workplace and Collaboration Services team in the OCIO offers specialized private training sessions for senior executives and large groups. In these sessions, your team will receive support on a variety of Microsoft 365 (M365) tools and topics. 

Private training for senior executives 

These private sessions are for senior executives (bands 4+) and their teams. The sessions can cover different topics, such as:

- Learning the basics of M365 tools such as Teams, SharePoint, Outlook and Planner

- Creating a plan to use M365 tools across your team

- Finding ways M365 tools can help solve problems or improve work in your team

- Sharing success stories from other senior leaders and teams in government

- Giving tips for saving time, staying organized, and working well together

There is no size limit for this training.

[Request training](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=AFLbbw09ikqwNtNoXjWa3GCjyf5XhGlGtcs0sTBOLAhUNjdQRTJXSERLMUlJS0pOV1Q5Sk5EMVZVOCQlQCN0PWcu)

Private training for large groups[](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Private-training.aspx#private-training-for-large-groups)

We offer private training sessions for groups and teams of 25 or more. Before requesting this private training, please review our [live training](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Live-training.aspx) offerings to ensure that your training needs cannot be met by an existing session.

*Note: the availability of private training sessions is subject to demand, and we may not be able to accommodate all requests.*

[Request training](https://forms.office.com/Pages/ResponsePage.aspx?id=AFLbbw09ikqwNtNoXjWa3GCjyf5XhGlGtcs0sTBOLAhUQ1JIVjc4Q1VTTkhJQ0QwVFlKRFczSVpNRiQlQCN0PWcu)

items.title: Tech Tuesday recording: May the files be with you - collaborating on files in the cloud
items.summary:
In this recorded training session, you will learn to work smarter—not harder—with cloud storage tools like OneDrive and SharePoint. Whether your team is working from the office, home, or a galaxy far, far away, these tools will help you store, share, and collaborate on files with ease.

We cover the essentials of cloud storage, including how to find and manage your files, share documents securely, and work together in real time. Plus, we bust common myths and share best practices to keep everything running smoothly and securely.

Don’t let file chaos lead you to the dark side, and *May the files be with you!* 🚀

This session was delivered in collaboration with CIRMO. 

**Learning objectives**

- Store files in the Cloud and easily find them when needed

- Explain the differences between OneDrive and SharePoint and when to use each one

- Use OneDrive and SharePoint to share files, track changes, and work with others in real time

- Follow best practices for sharing files, setting permissions, and keeping information secure

- Manage files across different storage locations, including OneDrive, SharePoint, H: drives, and Outlook

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.title: Tech Tuesday recording: say my list, say my list
items.summary:
This recorded training session is the first in a three-part series called [Microsoft Summer Jams](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Tech-Tuesday--Say-my-list,-say-my-list.aspx#microsoft-summer-jams-%F0%9F%8E%B6)**. **

Kick off your summer playlist of productivity with this intro to Microsoft Lists and Forms. We’ll show you where to find these tools, how to use private or shared lists, and how to build one using a ready-made template. You’ll also learn how to create and share your own form. 

By the end of this session, you’ll have a form that's ready to use in our next session and we will show you how to connect your Lists and Forms to automated workflows. Consider this your warm-up act for the summer’s main stage. 

**Prerequisites: **None  

**Duration:** 60 min.  

**Delivery format: **Recorded training  

**Learning objectives: **  

- Describe Microsoft Lists and how it can help you organize and track information at work

- Create new lists from scratch using ready-made templates in SharePoint

- Create and share a Microsoft Form with different types of questions (and optional survey logic)

Microsoft Summer Jams 🎶[](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Tech-Tuesday--Say-my-list,-say-my-list.aspx#microsoft-summer-jams-%F0%9F%8E%B6)

This three-part training series will show you how to organize, automate, and visualize your work using Microsoft Lists, Forms, Power Automate, and Power BI. Each session builds on the last—so by the end of summer, you’ll have a full playlist of tools to make your day-to-day smoother, smarter, and more efficient.

- Part 1: Say my list, say my list | Recording

- [Part 2: Oops! I automated it again | July 8, 2025](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/9134d6ce-372c-4bec-a768-092ad1c867bf%406fdb5200-3d0d-4a8a-b036-d3685e359adc)

- [Part 3: My data brings all the insights to the yard | August 12, 2025](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/a2bf7324-c64c-424b-8b80-0fc396a7c62e%406fdb5200-3d0d-4a8a-b036-d3685e359adc)

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.title: Tech Tuesday: Oops! I automated again
items.summary:
**July 8, 2025 | 11 a.m. - 12 p.m.**

**Part 2: Oops! I automated again**

This is the second session in the three-part **Microsoft Summer Jams** series. 

Now that you’ve got your tools in tune from [June's session](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Tech-Tuesday--Say-my-list,-say-my-list.aspx), it’s time to let Power Automate take the lead. This session will show you how to connect your Lists and Forms to automated workflows that handle the repetitive stuff—like sending emails, posting to Teams, or kicking off approvals. You’ll build a simple flow using the form you created in June. It’s like adding a smooth summer beat to your workday—set it and let it play on.

**Learning objectives:**

- Explain what Power Automate is and how it can save you time by doing repetitive tasks for you

- Give examples of simple tasks you can automate using tools like Forms, Lists, and Teams

- Build a basic flow that sends Form responses to a Microsoft List automatically

**Microsoft summer jams 🎶**

This three-part training series will show you how to organize, automate, and visualize your work using Microsoft Lists, Forms, Power Automate, and Power BI. Each session builds on the last—so by the end of summer, you’ll have a full playlist of tools to make your day-to-day smoother, smarter, and more efficient.

- [Part 1: Say my list, say my list | Recording](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Tech-Tuesday--Say-my-list,-say-my-list.aspx)

- [Part 2: Oops! I automated it again | July 8, 2025](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/9134d6ce-372c-4bec-a768-092ad1c867bf%406fdb5200-3d0d-4a8a-b036-d3685e359adc)

- [Part 3: My data brings all the insights to the yard | August 12, 2025](https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/a2bf7324-c64c-424b-8b80-0fc396a7c62e%406fdb5200-3d0d-4a8a-b036-d3685e359adc)

All sessions will be recorded and available on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Recorded-training.aspx).

items.title: Getting Started with Power Automate
items.summary:
With Microsoft Power Automate, you can save time and streamline your work by automating repetitive tasks. Join this session to learn how Power Automate works, how to create simple flows with connectors, and explore resources to help you use it more effectively.

**Learning objectives:**

- With real-life examples, see how Power Automate can save you time by reducing repetitive tasks

- Find out how to access and start using Power Automate

- Watch a demo of how to create a simple flow

- Explore resources to learn more about using Power Automate to streamline your work

Watch a [past session recording](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Getting-started-recording--Power-Automate.aspx).

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).

items.title: Getting Started with Power BI
items.summary:
With Power BI, you can turn data into meaningful insights with interactive reports and visuals. Join this session to learn the basics, including how Power BI works, how to connect it to different data sources, and how to create and share reports with others.

**Learning objectives:**

- Identify the main parts of Power BI and how they help you work with data

- Learn how to connect Power BI to different data sources and bring in data for analysis

- Create visuals to show your data and learn how to share your reports with others

- Know where to find more information and resources to continue learning about Power BI

Watch a [past session recording](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Getting-started-recording--Power-BI.aspx).

Explore additional [training and events](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspxhttps://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-landing.aspx) on [Your Digital Workplace](https://bcgov.sharepoint.com/SitePages/Training-search.aspx?q=&f=%5B%7B%22filterName%22%3A%22RefinableString04%22%2C%22values%22%3A%5B%7B%22name%22%3A%22Live%20training%22%2C%22value%22%3A%22%5C%22%C7%82%C7%824c69766520747261696e696e67%5C%22%22%2C%22operator%22%3A0%7D%5D%2C%22operator%22%3A%22or%22%7D%5D#).
